org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.power

Class PowerHostSimple

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.HostSimple
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.HostDynamicWorkloadSimple
        • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.power.PowerHostSimple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identificable, Host, HostDynamicWorkload, PowerHost
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PowerHostUtilizationHistory

    public class PowerHostSimple
extends HostDynamicWorkloadSimple
implements PowerHost
    PowerHost class enables simulation of power-aware hosts.
    If you are using any algorithms, policies or workload included in the power package please cite the following paper:
    • Anton Beloglazov, and Rajkumar Buyya, "Optimal Online Deterministic Algorithms and Adaptive Heuristics for Energy and Performance Efficient Dynamic Consolidation of Virtual Machines in Cloud Data Centers", Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experience (CCPE), Volume 24, Issue 13, Pages: 1397-1420, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd, New York, USA, 2012
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 2.0
    Author:
    Anton Beloglazov

                       long storage,
                       List<Pe> peList)
        Creates a PowerHost with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the host
        storage - the storage capacity in MB
        peList - the host's PEs list

      • PowerHostSimple

        @Deprecated
public PowerHostSimple(int id,
                                   ResourceProvisioner ramProvisioner,
                                   ResourceProvisioner bwProvisioner,
                                   long storage,
                                   List<Pe> peList,
                                   VmScheduler vmScheduler,
                                   PowerModel powerModel)
        Deprecated. Use the other available constructors with less parameters and set the remaining ones using the respective setters. This constructor will be removed in future versions.
        Creates a PowerHost with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the host
        ramProvisioner - the ram provisioner with capacity in MB
        bwProvisioner - the bw provisioner with capacity in Megabits/s
        storage - the storage capacity in MB
        peList - the host's PEs list
        vmScheduler - the VM scheduler
        powerModel - the model of power consumption

      • getPower

        public double getPower()
        Description copied from interface: PowerHost
        Gets the power consumption of the host. For this moment it only computes the power consumed by PEs.
        Specified by:
        getPower in interface PowerHost
        Returns:
        the power consumption

      • getPower

        protected double getPower(double utilization)
        Gets the power consumption of the host. For this moment it only computes the power consumed by PEs.
        Parameters:
        utilization - the utilization percentage (between [0 and 1]) of a resource that is critical for power consumption
        Returns:
        the power consumption
